chargeHist.descr: Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime

result.execSummary:
The defendant Steve R. Krall was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Enticement-Sexual Contact, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.07(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime

miscConds.notes:
Contact w/ minorsother than family members to be determined by agent.
Use of computers and smart phones to be at discretion of agent.

Participate in any assessment, counseling, and treatment as deemed appropriate by agent.
Sex Offender Registry.
DNA sample w/ surcharge.
Defendant is entitled to 5 days credit if revoked.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

timeConds.notes: With huber for work. 3 months I&S to be used for rules violations. To begin at discretion of agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steve R. Krall

Clerk: Britney
Case Called: 9:05 a.m. 
State appears by DDA Theresa Wetzsteon. Defendant appears in person with Attorney Harold C. Wolfgram. Date & time set for Sentencing Hearing. COURT previously found defendant guilty on Ct.2. All parties have received a copy of PSI. Court questions parties re: corrections to PSI. Attorney Wolfgram makes one change. State recites recommendation. Attorney Wolfgram makes arguments. Defendant addresses court. Court makes findings and sentences defendant to the following. 
COURT ORDERS: SWH- 10 years probation. CONDITIONS: 9 months MCJ with huber for work, 3 months MCJ imposed and stayed to be used for rules violations, participate in any assessment, counseling and treatment as deemed appropriate by agent, SOR registry, contact with minors other than family members to be determined by agent, use of computers and smart phones to be at discretion of agent, DNA sample & surcharge, CC. Jail to begin at discretion of agent. Defendant is entitled to 5 days credit if probation is revoked.

Probable Cause Found

No contact with juveniles under 18 years of age unless supervised by an adult. * Defendant may have contact with his own children without supervision.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. No computer unless for work.
